CSI API ETABS v1

cAutoSeismicGetASCE716 Method

Retrieves auto seismic loading parameters for the 2016 ASCE 7 code

Namespace:  ETABSv1
Assembly:  ETABSv1 (in ETABSv1.dll) Version: 1.0.0.0 (2.3.0.0)

Function GetASCE716 (
	Name As String,
	ByRef nDir As Boolean(),
	ByRef Eccen As Double,
	ByRef PeriodFlag As Integer,
	ByRef CtType As Integer,
	ByRef UserT As Double,

returnValue = instance.GetASCE716(Name,
	nDir, Eccen, PeriodFlag, CtType, UserT,
	UserZ, TopZ, BottomZ, R, Omega, Cd,
	I, Ss, S1, TL, SiteClass, Fa, Fv)
int GetASCE716(
	String^ Name,
	array<bool>^% nDir,
	double% Eccen,
	int% PeriodFlag,
	int% CtType,
	double% UserT,
	bool% UserZ,

abstract GetASCE716 :
        Name : string *
        nDir : bool[] byref *
        Eccen : float byref *
        PeriodFlag : int byref *
        CtType : int byref *
        UserT : float byref *
        UserZ : bool byref *
        TopZ : float byref *
        BottomZ : float byref *
        R : float byref *
        Omega : float byref *

        Ss : float byref *
        S1 : float byref *
        TL : float byref *

        Fa : float byref *
        Fv : float byref -> int

Parameters

Name
Type: SystemString
The name of an existing Seismic-type load pattern with ASCE 7-16 auto seismic load assignment
nDir
Type: SystemBoolean
This is an array with 6 inputs that indicates the seismic load directions
  1. nDir(1) = True = X Dir
  2. nDir(2) = True = Y Dir
  3. nDir(3) = True = X Dir + Eccentricity
  4. nDir(4) = True = Y Dir + Eccentricity
  5. nDir(5) = True = X Dir - Eccentricity
  6. nDir(6) = True = Y Dir - Eccentricity
Eccen
Type: SystemDouble
The eccentricity ratio that applies to all diaphragms
PeriodFlag
Type: SystemInt32
This is 1, 2 or 3, indicating the time period option
  1. Approximate
  2. Program calculated
  3. User defined
CtType
Type: SystemInt32
This is one of the following values. This item is used only when PeriodFlag is 1 or 2
  1. 0 = Ct = 0.028 (ft), x = 0.8
  2. 1 = Ct = 0.016 (ft), x = 0.9
  3. 2 = Ct = 0.03 (ft), x = 0.75
  4. 3 = Ct = 0.02 (ft), x = 0.75
UserT
Type: SystemDouble
The user specified time period. This item is meaningful when the PeriodFlag item is 3. [s]
UserZ
Type: SystemBoolean
This item is not used in ETABS
TopZ
Type: SystemDouble
The global Z-coordinate at the highest level where auto seismic loads are applied. [L]
BottomZ
Type: SystemDouble
The global Z-coordinate at the lowest level where auto seismic loads are applied. [L]
R
Type: SystemDouble
The response modification factor
Omega
Type: SystemDouble
The system overstrength factor
Cd
Type: SystemDouble
The deflection amplification factor
I
Type: SystemDouble
The occupancy importance factor
Ss
Type: SystemDouble
The seismic coefficients Ss
S1
Type: SystemDouble
The seismic coefficients S1
TL
Type: SystemDouble
The long-period transition period. [s]
SiteClass
Type: SystemInt32
This is 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, indicating the site class
  1. A
  2. B
  3. C
  4. D
  5. E
  6. F
Fa
Type: SystemDouble
The site coefficients Fa
Fv
Type: SystemDouble
The site coefficients Fv

Return Value

Type: Int32
returns zero if the function is successfully retrieved; otherwise it returns a nonzero value
Remarks
Examples
VB
Copy
Public Sub Example()

   'create ETABS object
   Dim myHelper as cHelper = New Helper
   EtabsObject = myHelper.CreateObjectProgID("CSI.ETABS.API.ETABSObject")

   'start ETABS application
   ret = EtabsObject.ApplicationStart()

   'create SapModel object
   SapModel = EtabsObject.SapModel

   'initialize model
   ret = SapModel.InitializeNewModel()

   'create steel deck template model
   ret = mySapModel.File.NewSteelDeck(4, 12, 12, 4, 4, 24, 24)

   'add new load pattern
   ret = mySapModel.LoadPatterns.Add("EQX", eLoadPatternType.Quake)

   'assign ASCE716 parameters
   Dim nDir() As Boolean
   Dim Eccen As Double
   Dim PeriodFlag As Long
   Dim CtType As Long
   Dim UserT As Double
   Dim UserZ As Boolean
   Dim TopZ As Double
   Dim BottomZ As Double
   Dim R As Double
   Dim Omega As Double
   Dim Cd As Double
   Dim I As Double
   Dim SS As Double
   Dim S1 As Double
   Dim TL As Double
   Dim SiteClass As Long
   Dim Fa As Double
   Dim Fv As Double

   ReDim nDir(6)
   nDir(1) = True
   nDir(2) = False
   nDir(3) = True
   nDir(4) = False
   nDir(5) = True
   nDir(6) = True
   TopZ = 32
   BottomZ = 14
   'set ASCE716 parameters
   ret = mySapModel.LoadPatterns.AutoSeismic.SetASCE716("EQX", nDir, 0.04, 3, 1, 1.76, False, TopZ, BottomZ, 6, 3.5, 6.5, 1.5, 1.9, 1.1, 8, 3, 0, 0)

   'get ASCE716 parameters
   ret = mySapModel.LoadPatterns.AutoSeismic.GetASCE716("EQX", nDir, Eccen, PeriodFlag, CtType, UserT, UserZ, TopZ, BottomZ, R, Omega, Cd, I, SS, S1, TL, SiteClass, Fa, Fv)

   'close ETABS
   EtabsObject.ApplicationExit(False)

   'clean up variables
   SapModel = Nothing
   EtabsObject = Nothing
   End Sub
